div.p: No. 7893, vol. 1870 W, VPRS 1168/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Letter not found; item is a register entry only, of a letterdated13 July 1870. [For permission to forward certain articles to Sydney Exhibition]
This letter was referred back to Mon19 July 1870marked 'forwarded',and returned to the Chief Secretary's officeon24 July.
M had been informed on 11 July 1870 that the trustees of the Industrial Museum needed a formal application to send specimens of wood to the Agricultural Society of New South Wales Metropolitan Intercolonial Exhibition; see M to E. Montifiore, 12 July 1870. The letter to McCulloch may have been prompted by that information. There were many other exhibits attributed to M, sometimes alone and sometimes as 'on behalf of the Victorian Government' or 'for the Government' (Intercolonial Exhibition (Sydney, 1870) (1870), passim). B70.13.05is a report of M's investigations on the fibres exhibited at exhibition.
